fields.summary: Have JIRA Search Function Return Results When Searching Legacy Issue Keys

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30244].
  {panel}

I am implementing Jira at a large company and we are looking to migrate a project that is currently hosted at a vendor site.  After a few hours iterative importing/exporting via csv I have 90% of what I need, but the remaining 10% is important and not available:

# Comments (showstopper): I can't export/import all/any comments via csv, and this is a dealbreaker as all issues have a variety of comments. Workaround = https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/it.skyit.jira.plugins.all-comments-cf
# Watchers (High): Similar to comments I would like to be able to export/import all the watchers of a given issue via csv

This just leaves attachments, which obviously can't be exported via CSV but hopefully I can get the Vendor to have them all copied over here.
fields.summary: Jira missing 3 items to easily import/export issues via csv from one project instance to another

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30243].
  {panel}

Currently it is possible pull more information with using expand in your call, for example:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/issue/JRA-22053?expand=changelog

The problem is that at times this provides too much information provided when using ?expand.  This is a request to implement limitation parameters to better define the results.

These limitations actually already exist for REST search requests, aka *startAt* and *maxResults*, but these parameters do not currently work with the expansion function.
fields.summary: limit number of results returned by REST request
Remove like's from moved item query
Add indexes to field / oldstring columns in changeitem table
User can set their own character limit for custom field
HTTP Requests Log Analyzer depends on standards and format configuration of the OS

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30236].
  {panel}

At the moment, you can only specify the search query based on keywords (such as project, fixVersion, etc).  It would be a great addition to the Advanced Search if a user can search based on the count number of a particular keyword.  For example, a user can search for issues that have 2 or more fix versions, or search for issues that have 2 or more labels.

As an example, a user provide the following scenario:

{quote}
Say I have :

    issue KEY-1 with fix version 1.0.0
    issue KEY-2 with fix version 1.1.0 and 1.2.0
    issue KEY-3 with fix version 1.1.0 and 1.3.0
    issue KEY-4 with fix version 1.0.0 and 2.0.0

I want to query for issues that have 2 fix versions (for example), independently of the names of the version itself
For example:

"project=KEY and nbFixVersions=2" => would return KEY-2,KEY-3,KEY-4
"project=KEY and nbFixVersions=1" => would return KEY-1
"project=KEY and nbFixVersions>=1" => would return KEY-1,KEY-2,KEY-3,KEY-4
"project=KEY and nbFixVersions=3" => would return none
{quote}
fields.summary: Add the ability to return search result based on count

fields.description:
Moving issues, bugs between projects throws system error.

fields.summary: Moving issues between projects throws system error
JQL for deactivated users
Diacritics support for usernames
Enhance JQL to include User Properties
Ability to automatically watch all subtasks of a parent issue

fields.description:
My Notifications Scheme is setup as follows : 

Event 	Notifications 	Operations

Issue Created (System) 	
    Current Assignee (Delete)

Issue Updated (System) 	  	

Issue Assigned (System) 	
    All Watchers (Delete)
    Current Assignee (Delete)
    Reporter (Delete)

Issue Resolved (System)
    All Watchers (Delete)
    Reporter (Delete)
    Current Assignee (Delete)

Issue Closed (System)
    All Watchers (Delete)
    Current Assignee (Delete)
    Reporter (Delete)

Issue Commented (System)
Issue Comment Edited (System) 	  	
Issue Reopened (System) 	

    Current Assignee (Delete)
    Reporter (Delete)
    All Watchers (Delete)



The problem is that those members are receiving emails for all events EXCEPT 'Issue Closed' and 'Issue Resolved'. Am I missing something? Please help.
fields.summary: Notification emails are not being sent for Completed or Resolved issues.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30224].
  {panel}

When you use the JIRA Send Mail option, in the past (JIRA 4.4.5), JIRA just took the sender from the From field, which is the user's email address. Now, it's using the configured outgoing mail instead of the user's email address and appending the username of the user to the front.

Example:
* username *abcd1234* with full name ABCD and email address <abcd1234@company.com>
* JIRA's configured outgoing mail as <jira@company.com>

If ABCD sends an email:
* in JIRA 4.4.5, JIRA displays the sender as "abcd1234@company.com"
* now, JIRA displays the sender as "abcd1234 <jira@company.com>"
(i) what is expected is: "ABCD <abcd1234@company.com>"

(x) It looks like <jira@company.com> is always displayed no matter whether a reply-to email is specified or not

(/) However, if a user clicks on Reply from his mail client, the correct reply-to email will still be used instead of JIRA's configured outgoing mail.

{panel}Since some companies have user ids that do not give hints of the names, JIRA should append the Full Name instead. Apart from that, the user of displayed email address needs revising to minimize confusion.{panel}
fields.summary: Send Mail option could use Full Name instead of username
Inline Editing Permission
URL in documentation is not working
Request to have getActionSortOrder() method to become public again
Provide a Link to JIRA Answers Under JIRA Help Icon
"The Resolution of the issue will be cleared." post function is not displaying correctly on the latest release
Allow admins ability to edit email subject line
Add ability to customize quick search

I spoke to [~andreask@atlassian.com] and he said that we would be better to catch the problem in the act and attatch a debugger so that we could see what is going wrong. I happen to agree, so if anybody sees this happen to another customer then please contact the DoS straight away and point them at the customers instance.

Other than that I am leaving it here because it may still be possible to work out the problem from the stacktrace in this issue.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit: Unable to progress with index greater than five.
Remove the need to start with a fresh database when restoring an OnDemand backup to latest available downloadable production version
Add an automatic refresh to the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30201].
  {panel}

When I am trying to chnage the project template from default to Scrum, it throws following error.

 Changing Template - Scrum 
The currently selected issue type scheme for this project is not compatible with the GreenHopper Scrum Issue Type Scheme.

Please migrate to the GreenHopper Scrum Issue Type Scheme by associating your project via Issue Types in the JIRA Administration console. Contact a JIRA Administrator to perform this migration.
fields.summary: Please change the BackTester (BTR) JIRA project  to use Greenhoper's Sprint Agile method of planning the board
Allow reordering of Move Issue screen fields
Allow disabling of save-on-blur for inline editing
Log work via REST API for a given user

fields.description: I added a comment in the existing issue, as a result system reloads the page but disappears the 'Drag and Drop' zone.
fields.summary: On updating something in any issue, system disappears the 'Drag and Drop' zone.
Change docs to tell database setup to be case sensitive
Enable Garbage Collection logging as a default with new JIRA installations
Support tools plugin is not enabled in OnDemand anymore
Group search is case sensitive on Project Role search
As a user, I can select projects across instances in the Project selector, so that I have a seamless experience, when working in multiple instances
As a user, I can expect my filters and dashboards to be in sync in a federated instance environment, so that I can work without disruption in multiple instances

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30179].
  {panel}

This addresses a scenario in enterprise environments with multiple instances, assuming that federated search is in place (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-22590).

If the user is executing a federated search while accessing an instance (A), he probably will see issues in a search result, which are hosted in a remote instance B.

The user should now be able to edit any issue in the result set without switching instances. Issues from the remote instance should be fully editable through the edit issue overlay. 

Only if the user opens the issue details page, this should redirect him to the remote instance.
fields.summary: As a user, I can edit an issue in JIRA instance A, while working in instance B, so that I do not need to figure out, in which instances my projects reside in
As a user, I can create/clone/move an issue in JIRA instance A, while working in instance B, so that I do not need to figure out, in which instances my projects reside in

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30170].
  {panel}

Search results coming from an API Call are slower than when you are returning them through the Issue Navigator. 

This calls for an optimization on the API stack in order to make it run faster.

*Mitigation:*

Reduce the number of issues in the response, paging, or reducing the number of fields.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30168].
  {panel}

Assuming a user wants to upgrade to JIRA 5.1.x, he/she would first take a look at [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Upgrading+JIRA].

There, in the [Before You Start|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Upgrading+JIRA#UpgradingJIRA-1.BeforeYouStart] section, it is mentioned:

{quote}
If you have installed any additional JIRA plugins (i.e. not included with JIRA), please verify that they will be compatible with the version of JIRA you are upgrading to. You can find a plugin's compatibility information from the the plugin's home page on the Atlassian Plugin Exchange. Once you have confirmed the availability of compatible versions, you should upgrade your plugins after successfully upgrading JIRA. This can be done via the 'Plugin Repository' in your Administration Console.
{quote}

However, in Atlassian Support we still get a lot of upgrade issues coming from incompatible plugins when our friends go for an upgrade. Some of them can be resolved by Atlassian Support, others need to be deflected to the plugin developers as, even though we want to help our friends, it is not possible for us to provide support for a third-party plugin we have no control on.

In that direction, could we perhaps edit the upgrade pages so that the following two points are mentioned:
* *Before* an upgrade, the JIRA administrators should use the JIRA Update Check (_Administration > Plugins > JIRA Update Check_) in order to see if some plugins are compatible with the target version or not. (We should make that more obvious as it seems to be missed).
* Regarding the third-party plugins (the ones that are not supported by Atlassian-this should be mentioned in the Atlassian Marketplace) the plugin developers should be contacted instead of Atlassian Support.

The results of this could be two-fold:
# Customers' time would be saved in the sense that plugins would be checked before the upgrade (sparing them the frustration of things not working)
# Customers' time would be saved also in the sense of contacting the right person (plugin developers) instead of coming to Atlassian Support and us trying to help, then redirecting them to the third-party plugin developers.

We are here to help our friends in every step of the way. However, perhaps changing our documentation a bit could make more sense and spare them some time.

It seems we actually have everything in [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Checking+Add-on+Compatibility+with+Application+Updates] but it is difficult to find and I don't know how many people would look for it when upgrading.
fields.summary: Point out the JIRA Update Check and third-party plugins in our upgrade documentation

It would be helpful if:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30144].
  {panel}

When performing a bulk update of issue links, it may be useful to opt-out of indexing to delay the re-index operation until the operations have been completed.

A use case for this is in GreenHopper's Story -> Epic association code. We have an issue link for a Story to an Epic, and when re-assigning a list of stories to another epic we have for each story:

* Remove the issue link for the existing epic, which re-indexes the story and old epic
* Add the issue link for the new epic, which re-indexes the story and new epic.

This causes two re-indexes on each story, and a re-index on the new epic for each story associated with that epic, as well as potentially multiple re-indexes on the old epic if more than one of the selected issues are currently assigned to the same epic.

(Due to another issue we are forced to re-index the epic another time after this, due to not re-indexing after changing the updated date, which adds even more overhead)

If we could opt out of indexing, we could collect the series of issues that require re-indexing as we go, and perform a single re-index per issue touched.
fields.summary: Allow calls to IssueLinkManager#createIssueLink and #removeIssueLink to opt-out of indexing

This is even shown in the documentation, [Time Tracking Report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Time+Tracking+Report]. Current versions of JIRA show the numbers in black.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30135].
  {panel}

We see the following pattern in On Demand:

An email is sent to JIRA which JIRA is not able to process because the username is not on the system.  This is typically due to a mistyped email address in the admin Gui, a message from an autoreply or other automata to JIRA.

JIRA then replies to that email with a notification that the user is not in the system.  When this reply notification hits the On Demand external MX servers, a delivery attempt is made and this fails (eg, if the message was from postmaster@ and the demote system is misconfigured and does not accept postmaster email).  This email then bounces and JIRA does not deal with the bounce, leaving it in the mailbox, or worse it generates another notification causing a mail loop.

Suggested Resolutions:

* Have JIRA only email an invalid address once
* Have JIRA set a hashed reply to address to monitor the source of bounces and use it to tie it back to the sent email and disable the user/notify the admin.
** Note, this will require work from Hosted Infrastructure in order to support
fields.summary: Jira sends emails that result in bounces and it does not deal cleanly with them

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30128].
  {panel}

When using the "Log work" feature, Jira will ignore comma as decimal separator, thus "7,5" is registered as "75".
If this situation is not caught before the next day, the burndown chart will look very inacurate and have reduced value.

I would like to see such input  either accepted as decimal separator OR treated as an invalid input.

*Step to reproduce*:
# install JIRA
# set the default language to English
# create issue and log work using "7,5h"
# (bug) 75 hours will be logged into the issue

Desirable result: 7.5 hours to be logged on or JIRA throws ERROR indicating invalid input
fields.summary: "Log work" ignores decimal separator

The documentation for Customising JIRA Excel Output says that the file {{searchrequest-excel-header.vm}} is located at {{src/etc/java/templates/plugins/searchrequestviews/}} of your JIRA home folder. This is not correct. 

The correct location is {{JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/plugins/searchrequestviews}}.

Please update the documentation with the right location.

Regards,
Ruchi

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30120].
  {panel}

I would like to be able to view the following metrics from Zephyr on the JIRA Dashboard via a Gadget:
 
a. Test Case Execution Metrics would be the major one, to give all stakeholders an view to what stage QA are at with a particular release
b. Overall Defect Distribution by Status Metric - very important chart also
c. Test Case Distribution by Phase - also important
 
How would you quantify the return on the work involved in setting this up?
 
In my organisation Zephyr was only purchased for the QA team and was carefully chosen for it's integration with JIRA which will be used by other stakeholders in the organisation that would not have the where withall, nor the interest to (nor would be allowed to) login to the QA Testing Framework to get access to these metrics. It was therefore a requirement to be able to export metrics to JIRA for this purpose. It has been stated that "Zephyr offers comprehensive and unique 2-way integration with both JIRA 4.x/5.x", if this is the case would it not be very little effort to create a gadget to display these metrics?
 
In my case there would be no loss to the viewing of the Zephyr Dashboard because these stakeholders would not have access to it, in fact I thibnk it would be a gain to Zephyr to be a viewable gadget on JIRAs dashboard and would expose Zephyr to alot of people that would not have heard of it before.
fields.summary: Support for Zephyr Metric Gadgets from Zephyr Enterprise Edition 4.1

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30103].
  {panel}

When JIRA checks email on a POP server, it processes email which has an Issue Key or an In-Reply-To header and adds that email as a comment to the issue.

In addition, it is possible to set up an email handler which will turn a new inbound email into an issue in a selected project.  This needs to be set up.

When this email handler is not set up, JIRA will scan the inbox and process any email that it can and leave the rest in the pop box.  This causes an issue in On Demand (and I believe in Enterprise) because there are a number of emails which will end up in the POP mailbox that JIRA will not process.  This count of emails grows and it sucks up resources because JIRA pop's its email once every 60 seconds, scanning this whole list every 60 seconds.

Examples of these include:

* Auto Replies
* Bounces
* Spam

To resolve this issue, I suggest setting up a default handler in JIRA which deletes any messages that JIRA does not know how to process from the mailbox so that it doesn't grow over time.
fields.summary: JIRA in OnDemand should have a default mail handler that removes unprocessed messages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30102].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Go to the new issue navigator.
# Click the share icon up the top right (envelope).
# Type into the "note" field. Notice that it doesn't grow as you type so it's hard to see what you've entered.
fields.summary: The share dialog should grow as you type into it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30099].
  {panel}

The tasks I have (actually via Rest API currently) in a project containing issues for version branches 1.x.x and 2.x.x:

* _Find all issues in the latest released version 1.x.x of project ABC_
* _Find all bugs in versions 1.x.x which are unresolved (known issues filter)_
* _Find all issues fixed in version 1.x.x_

As both branches are continuously released the version management in Jira resembles to this:

* 2.0.3-SNAPSHOT (next 2.0 release)
* 1.0.13-SNAPSHOT (next 1.0 release)
* 2.0.2 (latest release)
* 2.0.1
* 1.0.12 (latest 1.0 release)
* 1.0.11
* 2.0.0
* ...

My only idea: JQL should support fuzzy matching for versions. Examples for the three examples above:

* _Find all issues in the latest released version 1.x.x of project ABC_
{code}
project=ABC
  AND fixVersion in latestReleasedVersion("ABC","~1.")
  AND resolution = Fixed
{code}
I think it makes most sense here to extend the JQL function {{latestReleasedVersion}}. If the fuzzy operator should be part of the string I don't know. I think the assumption is totally valid that all strings specified here are for fuzzy matching so the prefix could be skipped. Unclear: How to extend latestReleasedVersion to find all released 1.0 versions across all projects? Perhaps: {{latestReleasedVersion("*","~1.")}}
* _Find all bugs in versions 1.x.x which are unresolved (known issues filter)_
{code}
project=ABC
  AND type=Bug
  AND (affectedVersion in releasedVersions("ABC","~1.")
    OR affectedVersion is empty)
  AND resolution = Unresolved
{code}
* _Find all issues fixed in version 1.x.x_
{code}
project=ABC
  AND fixVersion ~ "~1."
  AND fixVersion in releasedVersions("ABC")
  AND resolution = Fixed
{code}
alternatively:
{code}
project=ABC
  AND fixVersion in releasedVersions("ABC","~1.")
  AND resolution = Fixed
{code}

As you can see most of the time (for my use cases) it is sufficient to extend the JQL functions {{releasedVersions()}} and {{latestReleasedVersion()}}.

If it is easier to implement a new JQL function than you could introduce: {{matchesVersion("ABC", "1."}}. So for example the last JQL query would look like this:
{code}
project=ABC
  AND fixVersion in releasedVersion("ABC")
  AND fixVersion in matchesVersion("ABC", "1.x")
  ...
{code}

But I think this approach will not work nicely for to find the latest released version.
fields.summary: JQL: Allow fuzzy matcher for versions (fixVersions, affectedVersions)

fields.description:

a.b%2540c.com ('%' encoded)

If I change the URL to use 'a.b%40c.com', it works.

Coming from a dedicated customer:
---
Assuming you have two issues:

AAA-1 (in fixVersion 1.0)
AAA-2 (in fixVersion 2.0)

* Edit the fixVersion in AAA-2 to fixVersion 1.0 and then, in the issue navigator, look for
_fixVersion was in ("2.0")_

You get AAA-2

Then go to project AAA, merge fixVersion 2.0 into 1.0 and run the same JQL query.

You get _The value '2.0' does not exist for the field 'fixVersion'._

Can we make such searches possible?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30084].
  {panel}

When adding a screenshot to the ticket with height more then your display it will overlap the next section in the ticket overview.

For instance, in my Jira I have sections:
Details
Description
Attachments
Issue links
Activity

And I'm adding such a 'tall' screenshot. Then this screenshot in Attachments section will overlap the Issue Links and Activity sections

See attached image.


P.S.: I'm not sure in Jira version but think it is 5.0 or later
fields.summary: Attached images overlap sections under 'Attachments'
Allow filtering for both Confluence space and JIRA project in a single activity stream
Created vs Resolved Chart now missing vertical grid lines

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30077].
  {panel}

Would be good to have a "sum of" fields from time tracking field added to the 2 dimensional reports. In this way I could select my filter, select my X axis and then see how many total hours have been expended of a particular component.

For example if I had the following

Task 1 - UI - 2 Hours
Task 2 - UI - 6 Days
Task 3 - Services - 1 week
Task 4 - Database - 2 Hours
Task 5 - Database - 8 Hours
Task 6 - UI - 2 Hours

I am looking for an output that shows the following

Database - 1 Day 2 Hours
Services - 1 Week
UI - 6 Days 4 Hours


I want to aggregate hours across multiple issues, rather than manually having to tabulate them. I have components with the following names "UI","Services","Database". I then have issues which my developers log hours against. I then need to pull the total hours by component for a particular time period.

Nowadays the only possible way to achieve this is to create a filter and export it to Excel and generate the information from there.
fields.summary: New fields in 2 dimensional report gadget
Checkbox to send or not send email on bulk change page should be at the top
Rest API Documentation incorrectly lists "String" as a desired argument for "fields"
JQL key,issuekey searches should find moved issues
JQL Search when Link issue should have a paging option
